Object.Field:
Date: AUG-2004 Author: Sunopsis
Will Use a Jython Script to send HTML formatted Emails. Will allow user to enter a user name and password for SMTP authentication.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Modify: AUG-2010 Author: Aleksey Movchanyuk
?????????? ????? ????? ??????? ????? ???????? ????????? ?????? ? ??????? ???????? ??????
Port number used to connect to Mail Server
Is SMTP Authentication required in order to send email.
User name to use in order to login to the SMTP server.
Password to use in order to login to the SMTP server.
Email being sent to. Use commas to delimit multiple addresses.
Subject line used for Email message.
Set to YES to load from file
Set to YES to load message information from file.
Path to Message File. Be sure to use front (/) slashes.
Sample text for email message.\ Signed,\ SAMPLE
Text of Email Message. Ignore this if you are loading from a file.
Set to YES if this email is HTML and NO if it is plain text.

import sys import smtplib import MimeWriter import base64 import StringIO import javax.activation.MimetypesFileTypeMap as MimetypesFileTypeMap mType = MimetypesFileTypeMap()
sender = smtplib.SMTP('<%=snpRef.getOption("Host")%>',25)

#encrypt username and password user = base64.encodestring('<%=snpRef.getOption("User")%>').replace("\n","") pswd = base64.encodestring('<%=snpRef.getOption("Password")%>').replace("\n","")
#Initiate Login sender.putcmd("auth login") reply = sender.getreply() sender.putcmd(user) reply = sender.getreply() sender.putcmd(pswd) reply = sender.getreply()
filePath = '%r' % ('<%=snpRef.getOption("FilePath")%>') filePath = filePath.replace("\\","/").replace("'","") f = open(filePath,'r') msg = '' for line in f.readlines(): msg += line f.close()

message = StringIO.StringIO() writer = MimeWriter.MimeWriter(message)
writer.addheader('From', '<%=snpRef.getOption("From")%>') writer.addheader('To', '<%=snpRef.getOption("To")%>') writer.addheader('Subject', '<%=snpRef.getOption("Subject")%>') writer.addheader('X-Priority', '<%=snpRef.getOption("Priority")%>') writer.startmultipartbody('mixed')
# Write the Text part = writer.nextpart() textMime=<%if (snpRef.getOption("Is HTML").equals("1")){%>'text/html; charset=<%=snpRef.getOption("Charset")%>'<%} else {%>'text/plain; charset=<%=snpRef.getOption("Charset")%>'<%}%> body = part.startbody(textMime) body.write(msg)
# Add the attachment parts attPath = '%r' % ('<%=snpRef.getOption("Attachments")%>') attPath = attPath.replace("\\","/").replace("'","") attArray=attPath.split(",")
for attPath in attArray: partMime = mType.getContentType(attPath) print partMime part = writer.nextpart() part.addheader('Content-Transfer-Encoding', 'base64') part.addheader('Content-Disposition', 'attachment;filename=%s;' % attPath[1 + attPath.rindex("/") : len(attPath) ] ) body = part.startbody(partMime) #body = part.startbody(partMime + '; name=' + attName)
attFile=open(attPath, 'rb') base64.encode(attFile, body) attFile.close()
# finish off writer.lastpart()
